reference.title: Stage 3 proposal: Feature 13096
reference.shortdesc: Proposal to add a new element to support a troubleshooting section between the <result> element and either the <example> or the <postreq> element in a task topic

strow.stentry: Thilo Buchholtz, Stan Doherty, Kris Eberlein, JoAnn Hackos, Eliot Kimber

section.title: Approved technical requirements
section.p: Add troubleshooting section with a task: There is often a need to include a troubleshooting section in a task, specifically between the <result> element and either the <example> or the <postreq> element in a task topic. The purpose of this section is to help the reader resolve any problems that may arise should their result not match the result stated in the <result> section of the task. It is expected the reader would need this problem-solving information before reading the <postreq> section, since there would be no sense in moving forward if the expected result were not achieved.

refbody.section: Use casesThere is often a need to include a troubleshooting section in a task, between the <result> and <example>. The purpose of this section is to help the reader resolve any problems that may arise should their result not match the result stated in the <result> section of the task. It is expected the reader would need this problem-solving information after reading the <result> section, since there would be no sense in moving forward if the expected result were not achieved.

ul.li: This addition will benefit writers who want to provide important troubleshooting information within the task topic to aid users and have it clearly identified as troubleshooting information

This enhancement will have a significant impact because key troubleshooting information will be provided at the end of the topic if the desired result is not achieved and will allow the user to take the proper corrective action before moving on
Many people will probably benefit from this feature
This featureâ€™s utility will be comparable to that realized by the other semantic sections following the steps element.

section.title: Dependencies or interrelated proposals
section.p: This change to <taskbody> does not depend on, or interact with, any other submitted proposals. However, three other proposals relating to troubleshooting semantics are also being considered. The Technical Communication Subcommittee will provide the text explaining the interrelationships of these elements and attributes with the set of three proposals.

dlentry.dd: Add an attribute value to the <note> element's type attribute to distinguish troubleshooting information. Status: phase 3

section.title: Modified DTDs
section.p: A new element named <tasktroubleshooting> will follow <result> element and and precede either the <example> or the <stepreq> element as an optional element. The only DTD file affected is dtd.mod under technicalContent/dtd.
See Modifications to task.mod for all necessary DTD changes.
